TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ActiveDirectoryAuditRule extends System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAuditRule

Docs.summary: The ActiveDirectoryAuditRule is used to set an access control entry (ACE) on a system access control list (SACL). The <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAccessRule"> contains the trustee, which is represented as an <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.AuthorizationRule.IdentityReference%2A> object. It also contains information about the access control type, access mask, and other properties such as inheritance flags. This rule is set on an <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurity> object. After the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurity> is committed to the directory store, it will modify the security descriptor object according to the rules that are set on ActiveDirectoryAuditRule.

MemberSignature.Value: public ActiveDirectoryAuditRule (System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference identity, System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights adRights, System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags auditFlags);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference identity, valuetype System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights adRights, valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags auditFlags) cil managed

Docs.param: Specifies an <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"> object, such as an NTAccount object, that resolves to a security identifier (SID).

Specifies an <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights"> object, which is used to define all the rights that can be set on a directory object, as defined in the <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights"> enumeration.

Specifies an <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags"> object, which contains the combination of one or more audit flags to add to this <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule>. The allowable flags are <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags"> and <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags">. This parameter may not be zero.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule"> class with the specified identity, rights, and flags.

MemberSignature.Value: public ActiveDirectoryAuditRule (System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference identity, System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights adRights, System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags auditFlags, System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance inheritanceType);

Docs.param: Specifies an <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"> object, such as an NTAccount object, that resolves to a security identifier (SID).

Specifies an <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights"> object, which is used to define all the rights that can be set on a directory object, as defined in the <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights"> enumeration.

Specifies an <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags"> object, which contains a combination of one or more audit flags to add to this <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule>. The allowable flags are <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags"> and <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags">. This parameter can not be zero.

Specifies the <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance"> object that contains inheritance information. The allowable flags for this parameter are found in the <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance"> enumeration.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule"> class with the specified identity, rights, flags, and inheritance type.

Docs.param: Specifies an <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"> object, such as an NTAccount object, that resolves to a security identifier (SID).

Specifies an <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights"> object, which is used to define all the rights that can be set on a directory object, as defined in the <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights"> enumeration.

Specifies an <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags"> object, which contains the combination of one or more audit flags to add to this <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule>. The allowable flags are <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags"> and <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags">. This parameter can not be zero.
Specifies a <see cref="T:System.Guid"> object that contains the GUID of the object to which the access permissions apply.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule"> class with the specified identity, rights, flags, and object type.

MemberSignature.Value: public ActiveDirectoryAuditRule (System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference identity, System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights adRights, System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags auditFlags, System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance inheritanceType, Guid inheritedObjectType);

Docs.param: Specifies an <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference"> object, such as an NTAccount object, that resolves to a security identifier (SID).

Specifies an <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights"> data type object, which is used to define all the rights that can be set on a directory object, as defined in the <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights"> enumeration.

Specifies an <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags"> object, which contains the combination of one or more audit flags to add to this <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule>. The allowable flags are <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags"> and <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags">. This parameter may not be zero.

Specifies the <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance"> object that contains inheritance information. The allowable flags for this parameter are found in the <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance"> enumeration.
Specifies the <see cref="T:System.Guid"> object that identifies the type of child object that can inherit this access rule.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule"> class with the specified identity, rights, flags, inheritance type, and inherited object type.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryAuditRule"> class with the specified identity, rights, flags, object type, inheritance type, and inherited object type.
Gets the rights for the audit rule.
Docs.value: One or more of the <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectoryRights"> enumeration values that specifies the rights for the audit rule.

Docs.summary: Gets the inheritance type of the audit rule.
Docs.value: One of the <see cref="T:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectorySecurityInheritance"> enumeration values that specifies the inheritance type of the audit rule.
